description: Human Activity Recognition database from recordings of 30 subjects performing activities of daily living while carrying a waist-mounted smartphone with embedded inertial sensors (accelerometer and gyroscope).
creator: Jorge L. Reyes-Ortiz, Davide Anguita, Alessandro Ghio, Luca Oneto, Xavier Parra (Smartlab, University of Genova)
feature_description: 561-feature vector with time and frequency domain variables derived from smartphone sensor signals. Features include triaxial acceleration (body and gravity components), triaxial angular velocity, and statistical measures (mean, std, max, min, etc.) computed from fixed-width sliding windows of 2.56 sec with 50% overlap
use_case: Activity monitoring for healthcare, elderly care, fitness tracking, fall detection, lifestyle analysis, smart home applications

sensor_details.preprocessing: Butterworth low-pass filter (0.3 Hz cutoff) to separate body acceleration and gravity

data_collection: 30 volunteers (19-48 years) performed six activities while wearing smartphone on waist. Activities video-recorded for ground truth labeling. Sensor signals pre-processed and sampled in fixed-width sliding windows
signal_processing: Noise filters applied, separation of body and gravity acceleration, time and frequency domain features extracted using FFT
challenges: Limited to controlled activities, smartphone placement specific (waist), may not generalize to other devices or positions
advantages: Well-balanced dataset, standardized protocol, comprehensive feature extraction, widely used benchmark
ethical_considerations: Privacy considerations for activity monitoring, consent required for real-world deployment

citations.author: Davide Anguita, Alessandro Ghio, Luca Oneto, Xavier Parra, Jorge L. Reyes-Ortiz
citations.title: A Public Domain Dataset for Human Activity Recognition Using Smartphones
citations.venue: 21st European Symposium on Artificial Neural Networks, ESANN 2013

citations.author: Davide Anguita, Alessandro Ghio, Luca Oneto, Xavier Parra, Jorge L. Reyes-Ortiz
citations.title: Human Activity Recognition on Smartphones using a Multiclass Hardware-Friendly Support Vector Machine
citations.venue: 4th International Workshop of Ambient Assisted Living, IWAAL 2012

original_source.creator: Jorge L. Reyes-Ortiz, Davide Anguita, Alessandro Ghio, Luca Oneto, Xavier Parra (Smartlab, University of Genova)
original_source.publication: Davide Anguita, Alessandro Ghio, Luca Oneto, Xavier Parra, Jorge L. Reyes-Ortiz: A Public Domain Dataset for Human Activity Recognition Using Smartphones

Features include triaxial acceleration (body and gravity components), triaxial angular velocity, and statistical measures (mean, std, max, min, etc.) computed from fixed-width sliding windows of 2.56 sec with 50% overlap (feature 561)

dataset_history: Data Collection: 30 volunteers (19-48 years) performed six activities while wearing smartphone on waist. Activities video-recorded for ground truth labeling. Sensor signals pre-processed and sampled in fixed-width sliding windows
inference_notes: Challenges: Limited to controlled activities, smartphone placement specific (waist), may not generalize to other devices or positions. Advantages: Well-balanced dataset, standardized protocol, comprehensive feature extraction, widely used benchmark. Use Case: Activity monitoring for healthcare, elderly care, fitness tracking, fall detection, lifestyle analysis, smart home applications
